home.tagline: The conference for teams building developer platforms, tools, and ecosystems.
home.subtitle: Featuring deep dives on AI developer tooling, agentic platforms, and the new developer go-to-market playbook.
home.description: DevRelCon is the premier conference for anyone working to grow developer adoption — from Developer Relations and Developer Experience to Product Marketing, Platform Product Management, and Go-to-Market strategy. Join practitioners and leaders from the world's top developer platforms for talks, hands-on workshops, and the conversations that shape our craft.

speakers.title: Speakers
speakers.metaDescription: Learn how to evolve your team's DevRel strategy and tactics from our exciting lineup of Developer Relations leaders, practitioners, and community members.
speakers.description: Learn how to evolve your team's DevRel strategy and tactics from our exciting lineup of Developer Relations leaders, practitioners, and community members.

schedule.title: Last Year's Schedule
schedule.description: Here is our 2025 schedule for you to get an idea of what to expect at DevRelCon. We will be updating this with our selected speakers starting in May 2026. Want to see yourself on the schedule? Apply to speak at DevRelCon 2026! Speaker applications close on March 31st.

coc.title: Code of Conduct
coc.metaDescription: Learn more about our expectations for all those who participate in our community

neighborhood.title: Neighborhood Guide
neighborhood.metaDescription: Learn more about the neighborhood DevRelCon is happening in

getInvolved.title: Get Involved with DevRelCon
getInvolved.metaDescription: Speak, sponsor, volunteer, or host a side event at DevRelCon NY — the conference for teams building developer adoption.

convinceYourBoss.title: Make the Case for DevRelCon
convinceYourBoss.metaDescription: Everything you need to convince your manager to send you to DevRelCon NYC — including a ready-to-send email template.

location.label: Location
location.name: Industry City
location.description: Located just 20 minutes from Manhattan, Industry City is a historic shipping, warehousing, and manufacturing complex nestled on the New York waterfront. The space was reimagined in the 2010s and transformed into a space for designers, artists, and creators with studios, co-working spaces, restaurants, workshops, distilleries and breweries, and more.
